content.question: A train is moving forward with a speed <math alttext="v sub Train" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . A stone is launched from the back of the train with a velocity <math alttext="v sub Stone" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> relative to the train at an angle <math alttext="theta " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> above the horizontal, as shown. Which of the following expressions best represents the horizontal <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> position and vertical <math alttext="y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> position of the stone relative to ground as functions of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="x equals v sub Train, end sub, t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></msub><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals one half g t squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mi>g</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals v sub Train, end sub, t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></msub><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals v sub Stone, sine theta, minus one half g t squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mi>g</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, v sub Train minus v sub Stone cosine theta, close parenthesis, times t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals one half g t squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mi>g</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, v sub Train minus v sub Stone cosine theta, close parenthesis, times t"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals v sub Stone, sine theta t minus one half g t squared"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mi>g</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals v sub Stone, cosine, open parenthesis, theta, close parenthesis, times t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals v sub Stone, sine theta minus one half g t squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mi>g</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x equals, open parenthesis, v sub Train minus v sub Stone cosine theta, close parenthesis, times t"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals v sub Stone, sine theta t minus one half g t squared"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></msub><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mi>g</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
